body.p: Worked for the Rochester Daily Advertiser and learned telegraphy. Married Rebecca Sprague on November 14, 1847. Became Chief Operator of the National Lines in Cincinnati in 1848. Appointed the general superintendent in 1852 of the St. Louis and Western Telegraph Company, to become the Western Union Telegraph Company. Made the chief of the United States Military Telegraph Service (USMTS) on February 26, 1862. During the war he devised and implemented a plan to run telegraph lines to the headquarters of army and corps level commanders along with some of the first telegraph cyphers. Awarded rank of Brevet Brigadier General of Volunteers in March 1865. Father of Emma Louise, born in 1849, Annie, born in 1851, Charles born in 1860, and ellen Sprague, born in 1865.
